name: Oman Cownose Ray
description: The Oman Cownose Ray is a flat, disc-shaped fish with a distinctive snout, known for its schooling behavior.
spread_note: Found in the Indian Ocean, particularly around Oman.
food_note: Forages along the seabed, often in groups.
reproduction: Ovoviviparous, gives birth to 1-2 pups after 11-12 months.
attractions: Rare in aquariums due to their size, but notable for their graceful swimming.
projects_note: Not endangered, but fishing pressure is a concern.
breeding: Rarely bred in captivity due to complex needs.
